Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as an exaggeration since it implies that construction on the border wall has already begun, when in reality, only replacement projects for existing fencing have started.
Understate: The claim may be seen as understating the actual progress of the border wall construction since it implies that significant work has been done, when in fact, the projects currently underway do not fulfill the promise of a 30-foot high concrete barrier.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it fails to provide specific evidence or details about the progress of the border wall construction.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the replacement projects for existing fencing can be considered as the construction of the border wall, which may be a problematic assumption since it does not align with the original promise of a solid concrete barrier.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that the replacement projects for existing fencing are separate from the construction of the border wall and do not fulfill the initial promise made by President Trump.
